paragraphs: Professional architects, urban planners, and guides will conduct informative tours for free of hundreds of buildings across the Czech Republic. Moreover, many of these objects are usually closed to the general public.
This is the main idea of the annual festival "Architecture Day" (Den Architektury 2025), which will take place for the fifteenth time.
üìå It will take place from October 2nd to October 7th in Prague, Brno, Pilsen, and other cities.
üëâ You can view the list of participating venues at this link. Some of them require advance reservation for visiting.

This year, the festival will be subtitled "That Architecture" and will focus on the female contribution to this field in the Czech Republic from the period of the First Republic to the present day. The main goal is not only to showcase unique structures with a female touch, but also to reflect on the position of women in architecture over the past hundred years.

"Women have left their mark on buildings of various scales, designing embassies, bridges, schools... The goal of this year is to showcase the diversity of their creativity. We want to give space to their works and stories, inspire a more open perception of the architectural profession from different perspectives. The subtitle refers not only to the specific creativity of women, but also to a broader discussion of the diversity and variability of architecture itself," explained the festival director and architect Marcela Steinbach.
